jobs.job_text:
We are seeking a Remote Personal Assistant to provide administrative and personal support to our leadership team from a virtual setting. The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling a wide range of tasks independently. You will assist with scheduling, communication, project coordination, and day-to-day organization to help ensure efficient business operations.
Key Responsibilities


Manage and coordinate calendars, appointments, and meetings


Handle emails, calls, and other correspondence professionally


Schedule travel, events, and reminders as needed


Prepare reports, presentations, and basic documents


Conduct online research and compile relevant data


Organize and maintain digital files and records


Assist with personal tasks such as online purchases, errands, or scheduling


Ensure all communications and records are handled with confidentiality


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent (Associates or Bachelor's degree preferred)


1+ year of experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Virtual Assistant


Strong written and verbal communication skills


Excellent organizational and time-management abilities


Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and scheduling tools (e.g., Zoom, Calendly, Slack)


High attention to detail and the ability to multitask effectively


Reliable computer, smartphone, and stable internet connection


Self-motivated, trustworthy, and professional demeanor


Benefits


100% remote position,Â  flexible work-from-home schedule


Competitive pay and weekly or biweekly pay options


Paid training and ongoing mentorship


Supportive and collaborative remote team


Opportunities for professional growth and advancement

jobs.job_text:
We are seeking a Call Center Representative to provide outstanding customer service and support via phone and digital channels. The ideal candidate is professional, patient, and able to handle multiple customer interactions efficiently while maintaining a positive and helpful demeanor.
Key Responsibilities


Answer inbound calls and respond to customer inquiries in a timely and professional manner


Assist customers with product or service questions, troubleshooting, and issue resolution


Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions


Escalate complex or unresolved issues to supervisors or appropriate departments


Follow up with customers to ensure satisfaction and issue resolution


Meet daily and weekly performance targets


Adhere to company policies and call center procedures


Collaborate with team members to improve customer service processes


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent (Associates or Bachelor's degree preferred)


Previous experience in call center, customer service, or telemarketing roles preferred


Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills


Strong problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities


Ability to work independently or as part of a team


Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-volume call environment


Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, CRM systems, and call center software


Professional, patient, and empathetic demeanor


Benefits


Remote or hybrid work optionsÂ 

Competitive pay with performance-based incentives


Paid training and ongoing support


Opportunities for professional development and advancement


Supportive and collaborative team environment


About Us

We are seeking a Call Center Representative to provide outstanding customer service and support via phone and digital channels. The ideal candidate is professional, patient, and able to handle multiple customer interactions efficiently while maintaining a positive and helpful demeanor.

jobs.job_text:
We are seeking a Professional Personal Assistant to provide high-level administrative and personal support to our leadership team. The ideal candidate is highly organized, proactive, and discreet, capable of managing multiple priorities while maintaining professionalism and confidentiality. You will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of both business and personal tasks.
Key Responsibilities


Manage executive calendars, appointments, and meetings


Coordinate travel arrangements, events, and virtual or in-person meetings


Handle emails, calls, and correspondence professionally


Prepare reports, presentations, and other essential documents


Maintain organized digital and physical filing systems


Conduct online research and provide summaries or recommendations


Assist with personal tasks such as scheduling, purchases, or other errands


Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion


Collaborate effectively with team members to ensure smooth operations


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent (Associates or Bachelor's degree preferred)


Proven experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Administrative Assistant


Strong written and verbal communication skills


Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time-management abilities


Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and online scheduling tools


Ability to work independently and proactively in a fast-paced environment


Professional demeanor and a high level of discretion and confidentiality


Benefits


Flexible work options: remote, hybrid, or on-site


Competitive compensation and performance-based incentives


Paid training and opportunities for career growth


Supportive and professional work environment

evermoretravelllc.company_description:
At Evermore Travel, we believe that every journey should be as unique as the traveler. Specializing in tailor-made vacations, romantic getaways, and unforgettable group experiences, we craft personalized itineraries designed to create lasting memories.

Whether you're planning a dreamy honeymoon, a family adventure, or a milestone celebration, Evermore Travel combines expert planning with thoughtful details to ensure your trip is stress-free and unforgettable.

Our dedicated travel specialists take the time to understand your travel style, interests, and goals, providing customized recommendations that turn ordinary trips into extraordinary experiences. From luxurious resorts and charming boutique stays to cultural excursions and immersive experiences, we bring your travel dreams to life.

Why Choose Evermore Travel?
â¢ Personalized itineraries tailored to your unique preferences
â¢ Expert guidance for stress-free planning
â¢ Strong partnerships with trusted travel providers worldwide
â¢ Passionate commitment to creating memorable experiences

With Evermore Travel, your next adventure isn't just a trip â it's a journey crafted just for you.

ð Explore. Experience. Evermore.

jobs.job_text: Job Title: Online Reservation Specialist Location: Remote Company: Evermore Travel LLC Are you passionate about travel and eager to build a rewarding career from anywhere? Join our team as an Online Reservation Specialist and help clients create unforgettable travel experiences while enjoying flexible hours, unlimited earning potential, and exciting travel perks! What You'll Do: Assist clients in booking flights, accommodations, and vacation packages tailored to their preferences. Provide personalized travel recommendations using our trusted supplier network. Stay informed on industry trends, promotions, and exclusive deals to offer clients the best options. Utilize booking platforms to secure discounted rates, upgrades, and special offers for clients. Manage client relationships, ensuring seamless communication and top-notch customer service. Work independently while benefiting from ongoing training, tools, and mentorship Why Join Us? Flexible schedule work part-time or full-time from anywhere. No experience required comprehensive training and certification provided. Access to exclusive travel perks like discounted rates, FAM trips, and complimentary stays after supplier certifications. Opportunity to build your own travel business backed by an established and award-winning agency. Who We're Looking For: Individuals with a strong passion for travel and customer service. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Self-motivated individuals who excel at working independently. Comfortable with online booking systems and digital tools (training provided). Eager to learn, grow, and take control of your income potential. If you're ready to turn your love for travel into a rewarding career, apply now and start your journey with us!
jobs.job_html:
Evermoretravelllc

Online Reservations Specialist

Or refer someone
Job Openings Online Reservations Specialist

About the job Online Reservations Specialist

Job Title: Online Reservation Specialist

Location: Remote

Company: Evermore Travel LLC

Are you passionate about travel and eager to build a rewarding career from anywhere? Join our team as an Online Reservation Specialist and help clients create unforgettable travel experiences while enjoying flexible hours, unlimited earning potential, and exciting travel perks!

What You'll Do:

  • Assist clients in booking flights, accommodations, and vacation packages tailored to their preferences.
  • Provide personalized travel recommendations using our trusted supplier network.
  • Stay informed on industry trends, promotions, and exclusive deals to offer clients the best options.
  • Utilize booking platforms to secure discounted rates, upgrades, and special offers for clients.
  • Manage client relationships, ensuring seamless communication and top-notch customer service.
  • Work independently while benefiting from ongoing training, tools, and mentorship

Why Join Us?

  • Flexible schedule work part-time or full-time from anywhere.
  • No experience required comprehensive training and certification provided.
  • Access to exclusive travel perks like discounted rates, FAM trips, and complimentary stays after supplier certifications.
  • Opportunity to build your own travel business backed by an established and award-winning agency.

Who We're Looking For:

  • Individuals with a strong passion for travel and customer service.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Self-motivated individuals who excel at working independently.
  • Comfortable with online booking systems and digital tools (training provided).
  • Eager to learn, grow, and take control of your income potential.

If you're ready to turn your love for travel into a rewarding career, apply now and start your journey with us!


Or refer someone

jobs.job_title: Program Management Manager, Global Tech Services
jobs.job_text: Company Description We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people! We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued. With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. We are looking for you who is immediate joiner and want to grow with us! With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility. Job Summary: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Transition Manager to lead the global consolidation and transformation of Helpdesk/Service Desk operations for a major retail organization. This role is responsible for transitioning from fragmented, region-specific support centers into a centralized, scalable global helpdesk, leveraging an offshore/onshore support model. The ideal candidate will bring a blend of retail industry awareness, telephony platform expertise (Genesys, AWS Connect), and third-party managed service governance, along with deep knowledge of ITIL-aligned service transitions. You will lead the end-to-end execution of service desk transformation ensuring minimal disruption to retail operations. Key Responsibilities: Transition & Program Leadership Lead the consolidation and transition of multiple regional or legacy helpdesks into a unified global model. Build and execute a detailed transition roadmap with defined milestones, dependencies, and risk mitigation strategies. Ensure seamless handover to steady-state operations with no adverse impact to business-critical retail services. Retail Industry-Specific Service Strategy Align service desk transition goals with the unique demands of retail operations for 24x7x365 support Support for POS, in-store systems, eCommerce platforms, and mobile retail apps Seasonal volume surge management (e.g., Black Friday, holiday seasons) Ensure end-user support meets both employee (store associate) and customer support needs globally. Contact Center Systems Oversee migration or consolidation of contact center platforms such as Genesys (Cloud/Engage) and AWS Connect. Ensure omnichannel capabilities (voice, email, chat, social media) are integrated into the service desk solution. Oversee IVR redesign, call routing, workforce management, and SLA reporting during telephony transformation. Offshore/Onshore Delivery Model Design and implement an optimized global delivery model leveraging onshore teams for business hours and offshore teams for follow-the-sun and after-hours coverage. Partner with delivery leads and vendors to enable smooth handover, process alignment, and knowledge transition. Define clear R&R, escalation paths, and communication workflows between regions. Third-Party Governance Manage outsourced or managed service providers responsible for helpdesk delivery. Define and monitor service contracts, SLAs, KPIs, and penalties. Conduct governance meetings, QBRs, and implement continuous improvement plans. ITIL Process Standardization Ensure standardization and optimization of ITIL processes across all regions (Incident, Request, Change, Problem, Knowledge). Collaborate with ITSM tool owners (e.g., ServiceNow) for automation and dashboard reporting. Stakeholder & Change Management Serve as the single point of contact for all transition-related activities and communications across IT, business, retail ops, and executive stakeholders. Drive change management, end-user communication plans, and training readiness. Operational Readiness & Transformation roadmap Define clear service acceptance criteria, support models, documentation standards, and handover protocols. Ensure all teams are ready for Go-Live with supporting runbooks, SLAs, playbooks, and escalation matrices. Capable of defining Service Desk transformation roadmap for vendors to align and follow Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Business, or related field. ITIL v3/v4 Foundation required; Managing Professional or Intermediate certifications preferred. 10+ years in IT Service Management roles, with at least 3 years leading complex service transitions. Proven experience in retail industry IT operations, especially in environments supporting POS systems, in-store technology etc. Strong background in managing offshore/onshore service delivery models for global user bases. Experience with telephony and contact center technologies: Demonstrated success managing third-party vendors and service integration partners. Hands-on experience with ITSM tools, particularly ServiceNow or equivalent. Excellent communication and leadership skills, with ability to engage cross-functional and C-level stakeholders. Preferred Skills: Exposure to service integration and management (SIAM) frameworks ï»¿ï»¿ Start : Immediate Location : Bengaluru Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment. We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application. ï»¿ ï»¿ï»¿
jobs.job_html:
Program Management Manager, Global Tech Services

Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
Or refer someone
Job Openings Program Management Manager, Global Tech Services

About the job Program Management Manager, Global Tech Services

Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who is immediate joiner and want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Summary:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Transition Manager to lead the global consolidation and transformation of Helpdesk/Service Desk operations for a major retail organization. This role is responsible for transitioning from fragmented, region-specific support centers into a centralized, scalable global helpdesk, leveraging an offshore/onshore support model.

The ideal candidate will bring a blend of retail industry awareness, telephony platform expertise (Genesys, AWS Connect), and third-party managed service governance, along with deep knowledge of ITIL-aligned service transitions. You will lead the end-to-end execution of service desk transformation ensuring minimal disruption to retail operations.

Key Responsibilities:

Transition & Program Leadership

  • Lead the consolidation and transition of multiple regional or legacy helpdesks into a unified global model.
  • Build and execute a detailed transition roadmap with defined milestones, dependencies, and risk mitigation strategies.
  • Ensure seamless handover to steady-state operations with no adverse impact to business-critical retail services.

Retail Industry-Specific Service Strategy

  • Align service desk transition goals with the unique demands of retail operations for 24x7x365 support
  • Support for POS, in-store systems, eCommerce platforms, and mobile retail apps
  • Seasonal volume surge management (e.g., Black Friday, holiday seasons)
  • Ensure end-user support meets both employee (store associate) and customer support needs globally.

Contact Center Systems

  • Oversee migration or consolidation of contact center platforms such as Genesys (Cloud/Engage) and AWS Connect.
  • Ensure omnichannel capabilities (voice, email, chat, social media) are integrated into the service desk solution.
  • Oversee IVR redesign, call routing, workforce management, and SLA reporting during telephony transformation.

Offshore/Onshore Delivery Model

  • Design and implement an optimized global delivery model leveraging onshore teams for business hours and offshore teams for follow-the-sun and after-hours coverage.
  • Partner with delivery leads and vendors to enable smooth handover, process alignment, and knowledge transition.
  • Define clear R&R, escalation paths, and communication workflows between regions.

Third-Party Governance

  • Manage outsourced or managed service providers responsible for helpdesk delivery.
  • Define and monitor service contracts, SLAs, KPIs, and penalties.
  • Conduct governance meetings, QBRs, and implement continuous improvement plans.

ITIL Process Standardization

  • Ensure standardization and optimization of ITIL processes across all regions (Incident, Request, Change, Problem, Knowledge).
  • Collaborate with ITSM tool owners (e.g., ServiceNow) for automation and dashboard reporting.

Stakeholder & Change Management

  • Serve as the single point of contact for all transition-related activities and communications across IT, business, retail ops, and executive stakeholders.
  • Drive change management, end-user communication plans, and training readiness.

Operational Readiness & Transformation roadmap

  • Define clear service acceptance criteria, support models, documentation standards, and handover protocols.
  • Ensure all teams are ready for Go-Live with supporting runbooks, SLAs, playbooks, and escalation matrices.
  • Capable of defining Service Desk transformation roadmap for vendors to align and follow

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Business, or related field.
  • ITIL v3/v4 Foundation required; Managing Professional or Intermediate certifications preferred.
  • 10+ years in IT Service Management roles, with at least 3 years leading complex service transitions.
  • Proven experience in retail industry IT operations, especially in environments supporting POS systems, in-store technology etc.
  • Strong background in managing offshore/onshore service delivery models for global user bases.
  • Experience with telephony and contact center technologies:
  • Demonstrated success managing third-party vendors and service integration partners.
  • Hands-on experience with ITSM tools, particularly ServiceNow or equivalent.
  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with ability to engage cross-functional and C-level stakeholders.

Preferred Skills:

Exposure to service integration and management (SIAM) frameworks

ï»¿ï»¿Start: Immediate
Location: Bengaluru
Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.ï»¿

ï»¿ï»¿


Or refer someone

staffvirtualph.company_description: STAFFVIRTUAL is an American business process outsourcing (BPO) company with offices in the Philippines specializing in customer support, back office, and IT outsourcing. We also provide professional employer organization (PEO) or Employer of Record (EOR) solutions. STAFFVIRTUAL makes it easy for your business to outsource to the Philippines.

jobs.job_title: Program Specialist / Project Specialist (30K Sign On Bonus!) (Project-based)
jobs.job_text: We are looking for an exceptional Project Management professional for one or accounts. This role will help in managing, supporting, and monitoring a wide variety of site level and regional projects. From design to data and from strategy to development, you need to love getting into the weeds with problems to figure out how to break down barriers, improve our organizational capabilities and build sustainable solutions. You will also be expected to think creatively, identify data trends, suggest improvements and help in the creation of efficient processes. This individual will work closely with leadership to make sure that the scope and direction of each project is on schedule, and meeting the objective it was designed for. You will be working with a driven Project Delivery team, employees, stakeholders and management and will often be required to skillfully multitask. We have a small but highly capable and motivated team that drives APAC COE's regional and local strategy, goals, and execution. About the Client: A global platform where you can book rides and order food through an app, connecting passengers with drivers and customers with delivery partners. What You'll Do: Manage, support and monitor various regional and site level projects, across multiple teams dealing with subject matters such as quality and service improvements, creating and improving capabilities, data analytics, migrations, people initiatives, reporting improvements, process standardization, and keeping track of plans, quality and timelines for such projects Work with senior leadership as a thought partner to ensure we are able to achieve desired goals and work towards timely execution Strong written and spoken communication skills to ensure feedback for updates and completion of programs across multiple sites is captured accurately Help create and work through end to end programs right through ideation, execution and closure of priority programs for the region that may include data analysis. Estimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources accordingly, while driving adherence and compliance to deadlines on deliverables as assigned to projects. You will be managing a portfolio of projects under a specific region. You will be accountable in driving the success, completion, and reporting of projects and initiatives to the regional stakeholders and to the project delivery team lead Proactively work to remove or escalate risks or issues and enable forward momentum and progress You will potentially lead a small team of project managers and enable them to drive quality and completion of projects as well as handle administrative people management tasks. MUST HAVE: Project management experience for at least 2 years Positive influencer and strong culture advocate (internal) Excellent organizational skills to balance many tasks without losing sight of prioritization. Ability to stay focused under pressure, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence and motivate people at all levels across a broad variety of job functions Excellent written and verbal communication skills Demonstrated analytical success and the capacity for developing / understanding strategy Clear exposure to the senior leadership when it comes to reporting and/or creation of decks to represent projects Hands-on experience executing an initiative from start to finish. Achieves project goals while managing scope, time, quality and risk. Learn from failures as well as successes. Ability to work with remote teams and across time zones to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and creative work environment Independence in the event of remote reporting lines while still building strong relationships and a creative work environment with his/her manager, peers, and stakeholders across the distance Ability to understand complex concepts and work across multiple functions and teams. Demonstrate initiative, persistence, ability to creatively problem solve, and enthusiasm for learning new skills Experience creating case studies and working with various charting tools, such as Gantt charts NICE TO HAVE Have prior experience in both project and portfolio management in a scaled services organisation Has experience working independently with remote reporting lines PERKS: Php 30,000.00 Sign On Bonus! HMO Coverage Leave Credits Allowance Attendance bonus Monthly prizes and bonuses Up to 30K referral bonus Setup: - Hybrid (Taguig) - Shift: 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM (depending on business needs) - 6-month project-based contract with strong potential for renewal and regularization

Taguig, Metro Manila, Philippines

Job Openings Program Specialist / Project Specialist (30K Sign On Bonus!) (Project-based)

About the job Program Specialist / Project Specialist (30K Sign On Bonus!) (Project-based)

We are looking for an exceptional Project Management professional for one or accounts. This role will help in managing, supporting, and monitoring a wide variety of site level and regional projects. From design to data and from strategy to development, you need to love getting into the weeds with problems to figure out how to break down barriers, improve our organizational capabilities and build sustainable solutions. You will also be expected to think creatively, identify data trends, suggest improvements and help in the creation of efficient processes.

This individual will work closely with leadership to make sure that the scope and direction of each project is on schedule, and meeting the objective it was designed for. You will be working with a driven Project Delivery team, employees, stakeholders and management and will often be required to skillfully multitask. We have a small but highly capable and motivated team that drives APAC COE's regional and local strategy, goals, and execution.

About the Client:

A global platform where you can book rides and order food through an app, connecting passengers with drivers and customers with delivery partners.

What You'll Do:

  • Manage, support and monitor various regional and site level projects, across multiple teams dealing with subject matters such as quality and service improvements, creating and improving capabilities, data analytics, migrations, people initiatives, reporting improvements, process standardization, and keeping track of plans, quality and timelines for such projects
  • Work with senior leadership as a thought partner to ensure we are able to achieve desired goals and work towards timely execution
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills to ensure feedback for updates and completion of programs across multiple sites is captured accurately
  • Help create and work through end to end programs right through ideation, execution and closure of priority programs for the region that may include data analysis.
  • Estimate work efforts, define milestones and manage resources accordingly, while driving adherence and compliance to deadlines on deliverables as assigned to projects.
  • You will be managing a portfolio of projects under a specific region. You will be accountable in driving the success, completion, and reporting of projects and initiatives to the regional stakeholders and to the project delivery team lead
  • Proactively work to remove or escalate risks or issues and enable forward momentum and progress
  • You will potentially lead a small team of project managers and enable them to drive quality and completion of projects as well as handle administrative people management tasks.

MUST HAVE:

  • Project management experience for at least 2 years
  • Positive influencer and strong culture advocate (internal)
  • Excellent organizational skills to balance many tasks without losing sight of prioritization.
  • Ability to stay focused under pressure, prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence and motivate people at all levels across a broad variety of job functions
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated analytical success and the capacity for developing / understanding strategy
  • Clear exposure to the senior leadership when it comes to reporting and/or creation of decks to represent projects
  • Hands-on experience executing an initiative from start to finish. Achieves project goals while managing scope, time, quality and risk. Learn from failures as well as successes.
  • Ability to work with remote teams and across time zones to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and creative work environment
  • Independence in the event of remote reporting lines while still building strong relationships and a creative work environment with his/her manager, peers, and stakeholders across the distance
  • Ability to understand complex concepts and work across multiple functions and teams.
  • Demonstrate initiative, persistence, ability to creatively problem solve, and enthusiasm for learning new skills
  • Experience creating case studies and working with various charting tools, such as Gantt charts

NICE TO HAVE

  • Have prior experience in both project and portfolio management in a scaled services organisation
  • Has experience working independently with remote reporting lines

PERKS:

Php 30,000.00 Sign On Bonus!
HMO Coverage
Leave Credits
Allowance
Attendance bonus
Monthly prizes and bonuses
Up to 30K referral bonus

Setup:

- Hybrid (Taguig)
- Shift: 11:00 AM to 8:00 PM (depending on business needs)
- 6-month project-based contract with strong potential for renewal and regularization


Or refer someone

jobs.job_text: Job Title: Executive Assistant to the CEO Location: New York, NY (Hybrid  3 days/week in office near Grand Central) Employment Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire Compensation: $100,000 - $120,000 + Bonus + Benefits Overview: We are seeking an experienced Executive Assistant to support the CEO of a fast-paced and growing organization in New York City. The successful candidate will serve as a key liaison between the CEO, Board of Directors, and senior leadership, managing executive operations and special projects. This is a hybrid position that requires a strong presence in the NYC office three days a week. Key Responsibilities: Manage and maintain the CEO's schedule, appointments, and travel logistics Anticipate and resolve scheduling conflicts proactively Coordinate and prepare materials for meetings and presentations Draft and manage correspondence, reports, and confidential communications Organize Board meetings, record minutes, and track action items Plan and manage domestic and international travel arrangements Prepare itineraries, process reimbursements, and maintain expense reports Support strategic company initiatives and coordinate cross-departmental projects Handle confidential matters with utmost discretion Act as the primary liaison between the CEO and internal/external partners Qualifications: Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred 3-10 years of experience supporting C-level executives Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Proven ability to handle sensitive information with discretion Excellent time management and multitasking abilities Highly professional demeanor and client-facing communication style Local to New York City and available to commute to the office Benefits: Salary: $100K-$120K annually + performance bonus 401(k) with up to 5% employer match 80% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and pre-tax transit benefits Newly created position with growth opportunity
jobs.job_html:
Executive Assistant

New York, New York, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Executive Assistant

About the job Executive Assistant

Job Title: Executive Assistant to the CEO

Location: New York, NY (Hybrid 3 days/week in office near Grand Central)

Employment Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire

Compensation: $100,000 - $120,000 + Bonus + Benefits

Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Executive Assistant to support the CEO of a fast-paced and growing organization in New York City. The successful candidate will serve as a key liaison between the CEO, Board of Directors, and senior leadership, managing executive operations and special projects. This is a hybrid position that requires a strong presence in the NYC office three days a week.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and maintain the CEO's schedule, appointments, and travel logistics
  • Anticipate and resolve scheduling conflicts proactively
  • Coordinate and prepare materials for meetings and presentations
  • Draft and manage correspondence, reports, and confidential communications
  • Organize Board meetings, record minutes, and track action items
  • Plan and manage domestic and international travel arrangements
  • Prepare itineraries, process reimbursements, and maintain expense reports
  • Support strategic company initiatives and coordinate cross-departmental projects
  • Handle confidential matters with utmost discretion
  • Act as the primary liaison between the CEO and internal/external partners

Qualifications:

  • Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred
  • 3-10 years of experience supporting C-level executives
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Proven ability to handle sensitive information with discretion
  • Excellent time management and multitasking abilities
  • Highly professional demeanor and client-facing communication style
  • Local to New York City and available to commute to the office

Benefits:

  • Salary: $100K-$120K annually + performance bonus
  • 401(k) with up to 5% employer match
  • 80% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and pre-tax transit benefits
  • Newly created position with growth opportunity


Or refer someone

What We Do: MCTBack eliminates the need for multiple tools, offering a comprehensive solution that automates lead follow-ups, nurtures customer relationships, and manages every aspect of the sales cycle. Whether it's email marketing, funnel management, reputation management, or automated CRM, we've built everything businesses need to maximize efficiency and drive sales.

Why Choose Us?

Comprehensive Automation: MCTBack integrates all your marketing and sales needs in one place. No more jumping between tools â manage your entire business workflow from a single platform.
User-Friendly Interface: Our system is designed to be intuitive and easy to use, allowing businesses to get started without technical knowledge.
Customizable Workflows: Tailor workflows and automation sequences to match your business processes. Create personalized follow-ups, set triggers, and automate customer interactions based on actions or timelines.
Proven Success: Our clients have seen significant improvements in lead conversions, customer retention, and operational efficiency by leveraging the power of MCTBack.
Our Services Include:

Automated lead follow-ups and nurturing
Funnel and website templates
Integrated click funnels and email marketing
Reputation management to grow your businessâs online reviews

Our Mission:
We aim to provide businesses with the tools they need to automate mundane tasks, streamline operations, and drive real growth. GeneralWebers and MCTBack are committed to helping businesses scale faster, nurture stronger customer relationships, and close more deals.

jobs.job_text: The Remote Library Assistant helps library users and staff from a distance by making it easier for them to get to digital resources, helping them with research and tech questions, and doing administrative tasks online. The ideal candidate excels in communication, adeptly utilises technology, and is committed to delivering exceptional service from their home office. Duties: Help library users with their questions and problems through email, chat, and video conferencing. Allow people to access digital library resources, databases, and e-books from afar. Help people find their way around the library's website, online catalogue, and digital content platforms. Answer questions about references and research, and if a question is too hard, send it to a librarian. Help with online programming, workshops, and outreach programs. Handle online library card applications and keep accurate digital records. Help with the promotion and management of virtual collections and resource guides. Help the library with its social media and other ways of communicating. Do things like data entry, digital filing, and other office work. Fix and report technical problems with remote library services. Attend staff meetings and training sessions that are held remotely as needed. Other tasks that library management gives you. Qualifications: You need a high school diploma or the equivalent. An associate's or bachelor's degree in library science, information science, or a related field is preferred. It would be very helpful if you had worked in a library, school, or customer service before. Good at talking and writing. Being able to use computers, digital platforms, and online communication tools like Zoom, Teams, and Slack. Able to use library management systems and online research databases (training will be given). Very good at organising things and paying attention to details. Self-motivated, dependable, and able to work alone in a remote setting. A reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional place to work. Pay per hour: $25.00 to $30.00, depending on experience and location. Benefits: 401(k) retirement plan, health, dental, and vision insurance  Paid time off for holidays, sick leave, and vacation Opportunities for professional growth and training from home A schedule that can change Technology stipend or reimbursement (if applicable) Program to help employees Chances to move up in the company

Generalwebers

Remote Library Assistant

Boston, Massachusetts, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Remote Library Assistant

About the job Remote Library Assistant

The Remote Library Assistant helps library users and staff from a distance by making it easier for them to get to digital resources, helping them with research and tech questions, and doing administrative tasks online. The ideal candidate excels in communication, adeptly utilises technology, and is committed to delivering exceptional service from their home office.

Duties:

Help library users with their questions and problems through email, chat, and video conferencing.

Allow people to access digital library resources, databases, and e-books from afar.

Help people find their way around the library's website, online catalogue, and digital content platforms.

Answer questions about references and research, and if a question is too hard, send it to a librarian.

Help with online programming, workshops, and outreach programs.

Handle online library card applications and keep accurate digital records.

Help with the promotion and management of virtual collections and resource guides.

Help the library with its social media and other ways of communicating.

Do things like data entry, digital filing, and other office work.

Fix and report technical problems with remote library services.

Attend staff meetings and training sessions that are held remotely as needed.

Other tasks that library management gives you.

Qualifications:

You need a high school diploma or the equivalent. An associate's or bachelor's degree in library science, information science, or a related field is preferred.

It would be very helpful if you had worked in a library, school, or customer service before.

Good at talking and writing.

Being able to use computers, digital platforms, and online communication tools like Zoom, Teams, and Slack.

Able to use library management systems and online research databases (training will be given).

Very good at organising things and paying attention to details.

Self-motivated, dependable, and able to work alone in a remote setting.

A reliable internet connection and a quiet, professional place to work.

Pay per hour: $25.00 to $30.00, depending on experience and location.

Benefits:

401(k) retirement plan, health, dental, and vision insurance Paid time off for holidays, sick leave, and vacation

Opportunities for professional growth and training from home

A schedule that can change

Technology stipend or reimbursement (if applicable)

Program to help employees

Chances to move up in the company


Or refer someone

jobs.job_text: The Communications and Engagement Specialist is in charge of making and carrying out communication plans that help the organisation be more visible, get stakeholders involved, and reach its goals.  This job includes managing communications inside and outside the company, writing captivating content, planning public relations and outreach campaigns, and building strong relationships with important audiences.  The best candidate will have excellent writing, project management, and people skills, as well as a track record of getting people from different backgrounds to work together. Key Responsibilities: Create, put into action, and assess comprehensive communication and engagement plans that are in line with the organization's goals. Write, edit, and share captivating content for digital platforms, press releases, newsletters, reports, and marketing materials. Oversee the company's social media presence by making content, scheduling posts, keeping an eye on things, and analysing the data. Manage media relations by writing press releases, getting to know journalists, and answering questions from the media. Plan and carry out events, public forums, and outreach programs to get people involved in your organization's programs and activities. Build and maintain relationships with people inside and outside the organisation, such as staff, partners, community members, and the media. Monitor, analyse, and report on communication and engagement metrics to assist with strategy and decision-making. Provide advice and training on how to communicate effectively and attract people in a positive manner. Stay up to date on the best practices in your field, new technologies, and trends in public engagement and communications. Do other tasks that are related to your job as needed. Requirements: A bachelor's degree in a field related to communications, public relations, marketing, journalism, or a similar field. At least two to four years of relevant work experience in public relations, communications, or community engagement. Great skills in writing and speaking. Strong skills with digital communication tools, such as content management systems, social media management platforms, and design tools like Hootsuite, WordPress, and Adobe Creative Suite. Have planned events and worked with stakeholders before. Ability to look at communication metrics and make suggestions based on data. Showed that they could manage projects and keep things organised. Ability to work quickly and alone or with others. Very professional, creative, and flexible. Pay per hour: $28.00 to $42.00, depending on qualifications and experience. Benefits: Full coverage for health, dental, and vision care Paid time off for holidays, sick days, and vacation There are options for retirement plans, such as a 401(k). Reimbursement for professional development and certification Flexible work schedules (if possible, hybrid or remote options) Programs for the health of employees Insurance for life and disability Chances to move up in your career within the company
jobs.job_html:
Generalwebers

Communications and Engagement specialist

New York, New York, United States
Or refer someone
Job Openings Communications and Engagement specialist

About the job Communications and Engagement specialist

The Communications and Engagement Specialist is in charge of making and carrying out communication plans that help the organisation be more visible, get stakeholders involved, and reach its goals. This job includes managing communications inside and outside the company, writing captivating content, planning public relations and outreach campaigns, and building strong relationships with important audiences. The best candidate will have excellent writing, project management, and people skills, as well as a track record of getting people from different backgrounds to work together.

Key Responsibilities: 

Create, put into action, and assess comprehensive communication and engagement plans that are in line with the organization's goals.

Write, edit, and share captivating content for digital platforms, press releases, newsletters, reports, and marketing materials.

Oversee the company's social media presence by making content, scheduling posts, keeping an eye on things, and analysing the data.

Manage media relations by writing press releases, getting to know journalists, and answering questions from the media.

Plan and carry out events, public forums, and outreach programs to get people involved in your organization's programs and activities.

Build and maintain relationships with people inside and outside the organisation, such as staff, partners, community members, and the media.

Monitor, analyse, and report on communication and engagement metrics to assist with strategy and decision-making.

Provide advice and training on how to communicate effectively and attract people in a positive manner.

Stay up to date on the best practices in your field, new technologies, and trends in public engagement and communications.

Do other tasks that are related to your job as needed.

Requirements: 

A bachelor's degree in a field related to communications, public relations, marketing, journalism, or a similar field.

At least two to four years of relevant work experience in public relations, communications, or community engagement.

Great skills in writing and speaking.

Strong skills with digital communication tools, such as content management systems, social media management platforms, and design tools like Hootsuite, WordPress, and Adobe Creative Suite.

Have planned events and worked with stakeholders before.

Ability to look at communication metrics and make suggestions based on data.

Showed that they could manage projects and keep things organised.

Ability to work quickly and alone or with others.

Very professional, creative, and flexible.


Pay per hour: $28.00 to $42.00, depending on qualifications and experience.

Benefits:

Full coverage for health, dental, and vision care

Paid time off for holidays, sick days, and vacation

There are options for retirement plans, such as a 401(k).

Reimbursement for professional development and certification

Flexible work schedules (if possible, hybrid or remote options)

Programs for the health of employees

Insurance for life and disability

Chances to move up in your career within the company


Or refer someone

jobs.job_text: Job Title: AI Video Marketing Specialist Location: Remote Company Overview: We are a fast-growing European startup specializing in Microsoft solutions. Our team is passionate about innovation, collaboration, and building a strong brand presence across digital platforms. We're looking for motivated individuals eager to learn and grow with us! Job Description: We are looking for a skilled AI Video Marketing Specialist with a strong focus on creating compelling video content to join our remote team. This role involves leveraging cutting-edge AI tools to produce high-quality marketing videos that showcase our Microsoft expertise and drive our German market expansion. You will work closely with our marketing and business development teams to ensure our video content effectively communicates our value proposition and builds trust with enterprise clients. Responsibilities: Develop and produce viral video content using advanced AI tools such as Sora, Veo3, HeyGen, Synthesia, Runway ML, and similar platforms. Create engaging short-form video content optimized for YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, and TikTok to maximize reach and engagement. Use Midjourney for initial image creation and sequence design that feeds into video production workflows. Generate AI-powered audio content using Suno and other audio AI tools to complement video productions. Produce Creative viral video content to support our market expansion efforts. Transform written content, case studies, and technical documentation into engaging viral video narratives. Produce client success stories, testimonial videos, and thought leadership content featuring our Microsoft alumni team. Collaborate with marketing teams to develop video content strategies that align with business objectives and viral marketing goals. Manage the complete video production cycle from initial image generation to final delivery and platform optimization. Stay updated on emerging AI video, audio, and image generation technologies and apply them into operations and activities. Requirements: Proven work experience in viral video marketing and short-form content creation. Extensive experience with short-form video platforms (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok) and understanding of viral content strategies. Extensive familiarity with AI video generation tools (Sora, Veo3, HeyGen, Synthesia, Runway ML, Lumen5, InVideo, or similar platforms). Experience with Midjourney for image generation and visual sequence creation. Proficiency in AI audio generation tools, particularly Suno, for creating background music and audio elements. Strong understanding of video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or AI-powered alternatives like Descript. Good understanding of viral marketing strategies, social media algorithms, and B2B enterprise sales cycles. Ability to manage multiple video projects, multitask, and meet tight deadlines for viral content opportunities. Excellent storytelling skills and attention to detail in video and audio production. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of Microsoft technologies and enterprise solutions. Experience with B2B viral marketing campaigns in the tech or recruiting industry. Familiarity with additional AI tools such as ElevenLabs for voice generation and other emerging AI content creation platforms. Understanding of social media analytics and viral content performance metrics. What We Offer: Full-time remote work opportunity. A collaborative environment with a team of experienced Microsoft ex-professionals. A commitment to professional growth and continuous learning. Flexible work arrangements to match your lifestyle and work preferences. How to Apply: Interested candidates should send their resume, portfolio of relevant video projects, and a brief cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this role. Please include examples of your work with AI video tools along with the content you have created.
jobs.job_html:
AI Video Marketing Specialist

Nairobi, Kenya
Or refer someone
Job Openings AI Video Marketing Specialist

About the job AI Video Marketing Specialist

Job Title:

AI Video Marketing Specialist

Location: Remote

Company Overview: We are a fast-growing European startup specializing in Microsoft solutions. Our team is passionate about innovation, collaboration, and building a strong brand presence across digital platforms. We're looking for motivated individuals eager to learn and grow with us!

Job Description:

We are looking for a skilled AI Video Marketing Specialist with a strong focus on creating compelling video content to join our remote team. This role involves leveraging cutting-edge AI tools to produce high-quality marketing videos that showcase our Microsoft expertise and drive our German market expansion. You will work closely with our marketing and business development teams to ensure our video content effectively communicates our value proposition and builds trust with enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

Develop and produce viral video content using advanced AI tools such as Sora, Veo3, HeyGen, Synthesia, Runway ML, and similar platforms.

Create engaging short-form video content optimized for YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, and TikTok to maximize reach and engagement.

Use Midjourney for initial image creation and sequence design that feeds into video production workflows.

Generate AI-powered audio content using Suno and other audio AI tools to complement video productions.

Produce Creative viral video content to support our market expansion efforts.

Transform written content, case studies, and technical documentation into engaging viral video narratives.

Produce client success stories, testimonial videos, and thought leadership content featuring our Microsoft alumni team.

Collaborate with marketing teams to develop video content strategies that align with business objectives and viral marketing goals.

Manage the complete video production cycle from initial image generation to final delivery and platform optimization.

Stay updated on emerging AI video, audio, and image generation technologies and apply them into operations and activities.

Requirements:

Proven work experience in viral video marketing and short-form content creation.

Extensive experience with short-form video platforms (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok) and understanding of viral content strategies.

Extensive familiarity with AI video generation tools (Sora, Veo3, HeyGen, Synthesia, Runway ML, Lumen5, InVideo, or similar platforms).

Experience with Midjourney for image generation and visual sequence creation.

Proficiency in AI audio generation tools, particularly Suno, for creating background music and audio elements.

Strong understanding of video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or AI-powered alternatives like Descript.

Good understanding of viral marketing strategies, social media algorithms, and B2B enterprise sales cycles.

Ability to manage multiple video projects, multitask, and meet tight deadlines for viral content opportunities.

Excellent storytelling skills and attention to detail in video and audio production.

Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of Microsoft technologies and enterprise solutions.

Experience with B2B viral marketing campaigns in the tech or recruiting industry.

Familiarity with additional AI tools such as ElevenLabs for voice generation and other emerging AI content creation platforms.

Understanding of social media analytics and viral content performance metrics.

What We Offer:

Full-time remote work opportunity.

A collaborative environment with a team of experienced Microsoft ex-professionals.

A commitment to professional growth and continuous learning.

Flexible work arrangements to match your lifestyle and work preferences.

How to Apply: Interested candidates should send their resume, portfolio of relevant video projects, and a brief cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this role. Please include examples of your work with AI video tools along with the content you have created.

Factory Manager

MitrovicÃ«, Kosovo

Job Openings Factory Manager

About the job Factory Manager

Good Job! Good Life!ï»¿

The HeadHunter Group is an innovative Staffing and Recruiting Company with HQ in US, Dover, Delaware, operating in Canada, Albania, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Serbia, Cyprus, Greece. We offer the newest mentality in Staffing industry and our core business are Candidates and Clients.

Our client is seeking 2 (two) experienced Factory Managers to oversee daily production operations of concrete structures and prefabricated elements in its factories in Mitrovica and Gjilan. This role involves managing production capacity, planning operations, coordinating with technical and logistics departments, and ensuring quality and efficiency at all stages of the process.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan, organize, and supervise production activities.
  • Manage factory staff and assign daily tasks.
  • Ensure compliance with quality and safety standards.
  • Optimize the use of materials and equipment.
  • Provide regular reports on performance and production.
  • Collaborate with technical and senior management teams to improve processes.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree in engineering (Mechanical, Civil, or related fields).
  • Minimum 7 years of experience in production management, preferably in construction or precast concrete manufacturing.
  • Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.
  • Practical knowledge of industrial processes and equipment maintenance.
  • Experience with ERP or production management systems (preferred).

ï»¿Note: Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be invited for an interview.ï»¿

contegris.company_description:
Contegris provides Consultancy, System Integration and Innovative Communication Technology Solutions focusing on the enterprise market. Our areas of expertise are IP Networks, Unified Communication, Voice Communication, Telematics and Customized Web Application development.

Our team has decades of experience in Design, Integration, Implementation and Management of service oriented IT Infrastructure in the Enterprise and Service provider environments. Our competitive edge is that we do not just sell costly vendor made solutions; rather we do it byâ¦

â¢	Choosing the right technologies from the Open Source and Vendor Products which best suits our client's business and financial requirements.

â¢	Blend the technology with Innovation and deliver the optimum integrated solutions to our customer.
This approach not only promises customer satisfaction, but also ensures the use of latest technologies, future investment protection, cost effectiveness, easy management, scalability, reliable after sales support and Real Value for Money.

We believe that in order to survive in the current era of highly integrated global business environment, every business should have its own reliable IT and Communication infrastructure, Strong Security Architecture and Centralized Management capability without having to allocate a large amount of time and resources to it, so that they can continue focusing on their core business.

jobs.job_text: About This Role At Contegris, weâre on a mission to lead the Software as a Service (SaaS) industry with innovation, efficiency, and customer-first solutions. Weâre seeking an Executive Secretary to support our CEO in managing the fast-paced, dynamic environment of a growing SaaS company. This role is crucial in ensuring the CEOâs time is maximized, providing support in administrative, strategic, and operational tasks. This is not about being just a gatekeeper or managing calendars. Itâs about understanding the pulse of the business, anticipating the CEOâs needs, and acting as a bridge between internal teams, clients, and external stakeholders. What This Role Does Support the CEO: Manage the CEOâs schedule, ensuring the most critical meetings and tasks are prioritized to maximize impact. Communication Hub: Act as the main point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders, ensuring communication is seamless, professional, and timely. Strategic Assistance: Collaborate with the executive team to prepare for meetings, track progress on strategic initiatives, and ensure key deliverables are met. Project Management: Help drive operational efficiency by assisting in the execution of various projects across different departments, ensuring deadlines and goals are met. Information Synthesis: Gather, compile, and present relevant information to assist the CEO in making informed decisions quickly. Document Management: Draft, edit, and manage both internal and external correspondence on behalf of the CEO, ensuring high-quality and error-free documentation. Event Coordination: Assist in organizing key internal and external events, from board meetings to conferences, ensuring logistics and details are perfectly executed. Travel Management: Organize travel and accommodation for the CEO, ensuring efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Confidentiality: Maintain discretion in handling sensitive information, acting as a trusted advisor in matters of importance to the company. Who This Is For You have 3-5 yearsâ experience supporting C-suite executives, ideally in a software / tech industry, and fast-paced environment. You understand the complexities of working in a global, technology-driven business and can keep up with the pace. You are a problem-solver, capable of thinking ahead and anticipating needs without being prompted. Youâre incredibly organized, detail-oriented, and can juggle multiple priorities at once while maintaining calm under pressure. You have excellent communication skillsboth written and verbaland can draft professional emails, reports, and presentations with ease. Youâre proactive, not reactivealways thinking two steps ahead to ensure smooth operations. You can manage confidential information with integrity and discretion. Youâre not afraid of a fast-moving environment and thrive on change, continuously adapting to new challenges. What Wont Work Administrative professionals who are just comfortable with basic office duties and are not looking to engage in strategic thinking. Individuals who are uncomfortable with ambiguity or rapid changes in priorities. Those who do not thrive in high-pressure situations or are unwilling to take initiative. People who shy away from responsibility or need constant supervision.

About This Role

Weâre seeking an Executive Secretary to support our CEO in managing the fast-paced, dynamic environment of a growing SaaS company. This role is crucial in ensuring the CEOâs time is maximized, providing support in administrative, strategic, and operational tasks.

This is not about being just a gatekeeper or managing calendars. Itâs about understanding the pulse of the business, anticipating the CEOâs needs, and acting as a bridge between internal teams, clients, and external stakeholders.

What This Role Does

  • Support the CEO: Manage the CEOâs schedule, ensuring the most critical meetings and tasks are prioritized to maximize impact.
  • Communication Hub: Act as the main point of contact between the CEO and internal/external stakeholders, ensuring communication is seamless, professional, and timely.
  • Strategic Assistance: Collaborate with the executive team to prepare for meetings, track progress on strategic initiatives, and ensure key deliverables are met.
  • Project Management: Help drive operational efficiency by assisting in the execution of various projects across different departments, ensuring deadlines and goals are met.
  • Information Synthesis: Gather, compile, and present relevant information to assist the CEO in making informed decisions quickly.
  • Document Management: Draft, edit, and manage both internal and external correspondence on behalf of the CEO, ensuring high-quality and error-free documentation.
  • Event Coordination: Assist in organizing key internal and external events, from board meetings to conferences, ensuring logistics and details are perfectly executed.
  • Travel Management: Organize travel and accommodation for the CEO, ensuring efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
  • Confidentiality: Maintain discretion in handling sensitive information, acting as a trusted advisor in matters of importance to the company.

Who This Is For

  • You have 3-5 yearsâ experience supporting C-suite executives, ideally in a software / tech industry, and fast-paced environment.
  • You understand the complexities of working in a global, technology-driven business and can keep up with the pace.
  • You are a problem-solver, capable of thinking ahead and anticipating needs without being prompted.
  • Youâre incredibly organized, detail-oriented, and can juggle multiple priorities at once while maintaining calm under pressure.
  • You have excellent communication skillsboth written and verbaland can draft professional emails, reports, and presentations with ease.
  • Youâre proactive, not reactivealways thinking two steps ahead to ensure smooth operations.
  • You can manage confidential information with integrity and discretion.
  • Youâre not afraid of a fast-moving environment and thrive on change, continuously adapting to new challenges.

What Wont Work

  • Individuals who are uncomfortable with ambiguity or rapid changes in priorities.
